_header: It that I give I have / It that I lend I crave
_description: Moralizing lines on lending money — eight lines

CULLl510.Transcription:
It þat I gif I haueIt þat I len I craiffIt þat I
                    spend is myneIt þat I leis I fyne

CamMagPep2553.Transcription:
It þat I gif I haifIt þat I len I
                    craiff……get and saif and þou sall haifwaist and want
                    len and craiff
CamMagPep2553.Note:
Written two lines verse to a line in MS; immediately followed by 6554 without a break; three
                    couplets.
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.344.

Banna.Transcription:
It þat I gife I haifIt þat I len I craifIt þat I
                    spend is myneIt þat I leif I tynegett and saifand thow sall
                        haifWe len and grantAnd thow sall want
Banna.Note: 4 x 2; written two lines of verse per line of MS; followed 6554.

Fox,  Denton,  and  William A. Ringler.  
             The Bannatyne Manuscript: National Library of Scotland Advocates’
                MS. 1.1.6
         London: Scolar Press, in Association with The National Library of
